data.title: Vietnamese?
data.text: Ok, even after 18 months in VietNam, ok, they didn't like us then... I didn't try Vietnamese cuisine... And, I'm not sure why I'm trying it now, except the "boss" likes it, so I do what I'm told... But some of what I've tried is darn good... Just don't ask me to say what it was, what they called it, or anything except how good!!! What I tried was, and that's enough said, you go experiment on your own...

data.title: Great Vietnamese
data.text: Three different meals and we were all delighted. Food was fantastic and the service was spot-on. We were reminiscing, took up the table for 2 1/2 hours, and they were perfectly okay with it. Great place!

data.title: Great Place!!
data.text: A great place for asian fusion food and the bar is always busy. Easliy the best asian style food in the city. They serve large portions so prepare to be stuffed! The bartenders are friendly and there are a few big screens that always have some game on. Parking a limited because of the downtown location. Everybody says if you are in Pittsburg, make sure to eat at The New Mecca, but I say don't miss CreAsian!!

data.title: Yummy yummy yummy!
data.text: I wish i discovered this place when it first opened instead of 1 month before i moved away from the pitt!  As anyone knows there are 2 few places that offerdelicious non-franchise type food around these parts and Cre-Asian is one of them. Not only is the location pretty awesome (in the quaint and underdeveloped main street downtown) but its a nice place to watch a game at the bar (pretty signifigant selection of unique cocktails plus full bar) but it also seems nice for a family outing. Try their beef dishes so succulent and juicy with flavor flavor flavor!

data.title: great place to eat
data.text: great food and great service all I have to say is the emploees are just great that is why my family keeps going back

data.title: Best shaking beef w/garlic noodles around!
data.text: Great food at both the Antioch and Pittsburg locations. Pittsburg gets a bit loud for us sometimes, but take-out is a convenient option.

data.title: Marvelous!!
data.text: I absolutely love this place! Their shaking beef with noodles is tasty and seasoned perfectly. Their vermicelli bowls, likewise, are filled with fresh veggies and delish! Since it's right around the corner, it's one of our favorite go-to places.

data.title: Yummy yummy yummy
data.text: Luv this place! Bummed i didnt discover it earlier when i lived here beef dish was delish and bar is full stocked.  Prices are decent and its in downtown pittsburg which is seeing a bit of a revitalization. Please do frequent the establishments there as it is a quaint little area and deserves to see more businesses move in.

data.title: Exploration
data.text: Went to see what the buzz. Had to try something new. Got me the pork chop plate and my wife the garlic noodle. Good food and friendly crew.

data.title: Yummy food!
data.text: This place is ALWAYS busy! Their food is tasty although the service is a bit slow. But they are always super nice. However I did notice that the last time we were there, I had less food on my plate on the same thing that I always order. And they are slightly overpriced. But the food is great! Great place to go and chill if you are not in a hurry.

data.title: Yummy food at a good price!
data.text: I highly recommend Cre Asian Bistro in Pittsburg, CA.  The location is great.  Downtown Pittsburg is very picturesque with palm trees and fairy lights in the trees at night. The restaurant sits on a corner with a park across the street. I love sitting outside on the patio facing the park with the water from the Delta making a great view in the distance. Although this restaurant is part of a chain, it feels like a neighborhood spot. Food is reasonably priced. I usually order #62 which is bird's nest noodles with wok-fried chicken and shrimp and vegetables.  I dream of the delicious sauce!  Cost is $9.00 for a healthy portion which can be stretched to two or three meals.  There are many items that cost even less. The cuisine is listed as authentic Vietnamese, but you can find dishes that seem more Chinese or more Thai or more Korean. There is a good variety to choose from. I have gone there for intimate meals and large group luncheons. I have eaten both outside and inside. Service has always been quick and efficient.  There are TV's scattered around the room for viewing sports, if you are so inclined.  There is also a full bar.  Take out service is available. All of my companions have been pleased with their meals. The only complaint that I have ever heard (AFTER the persons stated their food was delicious) was that items marked as hot and spicy could have been even more hot and spicy. Go and try it for yourself!

data.title: Great food
data.text: We love this place, from the first time we went there they make you feel like family. The food is always fresh and tastey.

data.title: Tasty
data.text: Had lunch.  Ordered the fresh spring rolls appetizer and the curry chicken rice dish.  Was all very tasty and fresh.  I couldn't eat all the curry dish at lunch, so ate it for dinner.  The leftovers were delicious as well.  Would return for sure.  Nice ambiance.

data.title: Fresh and Yummy
data.text: We have only been here once (so far!), but it was terrific.  The food was fresh and original.  Definitely try the garlic noodles.

data.title: Large groups ok
data.text: They accommodated a large group from our church very well. Allowed individual checks, which was very helpful. Healthy affordable fare.

data.title: Very friendly staff and really good food.
data.text: If you need a quick healthy meal, CreAsian is a great choice on downtown Pittsburg. The food is Vietnamese with some variations, fresh, very tasty and boy do they serve it quickly. Waitstaff is in a hurry but very friendly and helpful. Great choice.
